description.narrative: Stöd till den svenska plattformens verksamhet med länderna inom Östliga partnerskapet. Stödet syftar till att utvidga och bidra med fortsatt stöd till Forum Syd för att vidareutveckla den svenska plattformens verksamhet i länderna inom Östliga partnerskapet. Stödet täcker Armenien , Azerbajdzjan , Vitryssland , Georgien , Moldavien och Ukraina. Plattformen syftar till att bidra till en demokratisk utveckling inom länderna genom ökat samarbete mellan svenska CSO och genom stärkt samarbete med CSO från länderna inom Östliga partnerskapet. Syftet med projektet är att bidra till målet att främja ett starkare och mer pluralistiskt samhälle i dessa länder. Det syftar vidare till att stödja ett civilt samhälle som gör det möjligt för människor att förändra sina liv och samhällen på lokal, regional , nationell och global nivå. Slutligen syftar projektet till att bidra till ökade kontakter och ökat samarbete mellan det civila samhället i länderna inom Östliga partnerskapet och EU:s medlemsländer.
Support to the ASwedish Plattform and the work they do in the EaP region

description.narrative: Due to the pandemic restriction the Network had to change its plans significantly. This could mainly be summorised with that almost all activities were carriedout in a digital format. None the less, the network has carried out all the planned activities (totally four), a series of consultations with the Swedish MFA on new Swedish and EU strategies towards the region as well as several advocacy and information campaigns related to the freedom of information. Webinars that were organised on the protests in Belarus, on digital activism in Russia and on Media freedom in Ukraine (organised on the digital Global Aquare on the Book Fair) all gathered a wide audience. The network also organised a digital training on Human Rights Based Approach for the members in cooperation with the Danish Institute for Human Rights. There was a field trip to Ukraine planned but it was postponed until 2021. With the pandemic restrictions still ongoing it is although unlikely that it can be carried out. Taking this into account with other events that were carried out in a digital format the result is that there has been an underspending in the programme during 2020. In 2019 tickets for two Armenian representatives visiting Sweden were bought. The trip was cancelled due to the pandemic restrictions. The issue was solved with Sida and ForumCiv made a repayment in summer 2020. In the autumn of 2020 a pre-study for Armenia was started since ForumCiv wants to assess the possibilites for starting a programme in Armenia. The plan for the pre-study had to be changed because of the war in Karabakh but it is planned to be finalised in the end February 2021. In conclusion, there has been challenges during 2020 that could not be planned for in advanced and therefor had to be adopted to as they occured. The programme has although been able to continue more or less according to the original plan with some delays. The dialogue with Sida will continue to be important and as a prolongation might be necessary because of the underspending that will most probably continue during 2021.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
